title: DOHA JOUR 370-0-70 Media Law & Ethics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Media Law & Ethics takes a comparative approach, using American jurisprudence as a foundation, to introduce student to the legal and ethical principles needed to engage in responsible communication. In addition to learning the fundamental theories of freedom of expression, students will immerse themselves in the law of defamation, intellectual property and privacy through case studies and in-class exercises that emphasize the application of those principles in a global setting. Throughout the course, attention will be paid to reading primary source materials, including Qatari laws that regulate the media. Using the legal and ethical principles they've learned, students will complete a content production project that explores a legal or ethical topic of their choosing at the conclusion of the semester.
